reviews.text: I stayed here as I had to attend a conference,greeted by staff with no-speaka-de-english on the front desk.so in broken english i managed to find that breakfast was included in the price,beware to check or it'll set you back £15.The room was fairly clean and tidy,with a nice large bathroom,the furniture was rather old fashioned and the noise from the train station announcements and constant movement of railfreight in the early hours added nothing to add to comfort.A sparse selection of tea bags and coffee was the in room facility! wonderful!
reviews.title: overpriced and very poor standards
Fantastic hotel for a weekend getaway
reviews.text: Stationery was left,with envelopes,quite convienient,but when you left letters on reception to be posted through the post room,i find that a week letter the 6 people i wrote to all incurred £1.21 each in surcharges because the concierge had not had the intelligence to put them through the postal meter.
Breakfast on the Thursday was sparse no bacon,no eggs and no beans and you had to make three trips back as each item to create a full english breakfast arrived bit by bit on the buffet.
reviews.title: Great staff, but over-priced
Convenient luxury accomodation
reviews.text: I found too as another writer did a problem with heating in the room,mine wouldnt turn on.

At 5.30pm one night the whole hotel was left without hot water due to a boiler failing and just as everyone was about to go out to a dinner at the rail museum and so needed to get washed before going.The token recompense a £2.99 bottle of wine and an apology letter on your dresser on return.
reviews.title: Awful Awful Awful!!!

reviews.text: When I read the other reviews on this hotel I was confused -- I thought I had the wrong hotel name!
reviews.title: A splendid room, fantastic view, wonderful staff

reviews.text: Our stay was wonderful - the room was huge -- a true kingsize bed that was comfortable, a separate sitting area with comfortable seating, and a bathroom that was magnificent -- very modern and most importantly immaculately clean. A glass wall in the shower was really interesting. Large closets, with in room coffee,etc. separated from the main area of our room, across the hall from the bath.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but Overpriced

reviews.text: We were there the week between Christmas and Hogmanay and I really enjoyed the Christmas tree in our room as well as the large tree in the reception area. The view of the Minister from our room was fantastic -- especially with the large snowflakes falling! (and I didn't have to worry about shoveling it!.)
reviews.title: Not as Brilliant as anticipated!!
Very Helpful Staff
reviews.text: The staff was really helpful - when we were checking out, it was pointed out to us that our rate included breakfast -- even though it was very close to the time that breakfast was due to no longer be served -- we were walked over to the dining area. Even though we were late, the restaurant staff made sure that we had everything we could wish for from the buffet. The porter stashed our bags for us while we had breakfast and spent the day in York, and when it came time to catch the train, it was an easy matter to get our bags back and over to the train station -- across the drive!

reviews.title: Excellent for disabled person (wheelchair)
reviews.text: The next time we go to York, we plan to stay here again! If you have a railroad buff in the family, the Rail museum is convenient and interesting --- even to those of us that aren't rail buffs. The location was convenient to the areas most tourists are interested in and the sightseeing bus is very close.
We arrived, lateish, on a Friday evening to be met with a very pleasant young lady on reception.
reviews.title: Very Nice Experience
No complaints at all
reviews.text: Our booking had been for a twin room, but, on request, we were immediately switched to a double room.
Effortless check-in and clear instructions on how to find our room.
reviews.title: Rip off
fabulous ! Saw a few celebs as well staying there too!!
reviews.text: Reception experience - faultless.

reviews.title: This Hotel is stealing your money
reviews.text: Due to the lateish arrival, we decided to have dinner in the hotel's dining room.

My wife and I stayed at the Royal York over the easter weekend. We travelled up to York from Manchester so the location was great for that - it is literally next door to the main train station. But don't be fooled by the photos of the views over to Yorkminster - As you can see from our pix we had a view of the Royal Mail depot instead.
reviews.title: Great for train travellers...

reviews.text: Having said that, the room was pretty nice, everything was immaculate, the hotel foyer and the building is quite luxurious - you really feel like royalty! Best part for us though was the pool, steam room and spa. After a long day walking around York it was great to come back and relax in the pool.
reviews.title: What a Disappointment

reviews.text: We did spy a few hotels that were closer to the sights in the city and that weren't as expensive - so we'd probably go with those before we'd come back to the Royal York. But if you are coming in by train and want to be closeby to the station you can't beat this place.
reviews.title: Overall a nice place to stay

reviews.text: Being regular visitors to York over several years, my wife and I decided to stay at the Royal York with our two boys, aged 9 and 6 because we had seen it over the years and because we knew it had a pool, to relax in at the end of a hard days sight seeing.
reviews.title: Weekend Birthday Break
One of the worst experiences ever
reviews.text: We booked a family room with a double and two singles and were advised it would be in the new extension.
